contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> File:SanFranHouses06.JPG|Damage from the 1906 San Francisco earthquake File:Sfearthquake3b.jpg|Damage from the 1906 San Francisco earthquake File:Petersdom von Engelsburg gesehen.jpg|St. Peter's Basilica in 2004 File:Army B-25 (Doolittle Raid).jpg|A B-25 launching from the USS Hornet during Col. Doolittle's Raid File:Boleslaus I.jpg|Boleslaus I of Poland </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | [[List of national independence days|Independence Day]] in '''[[Zimbabwe]]''' ([[1980]]) | outdated |- |[[1025]] – '''[[Bolesław I Chrobry]]''' became the first [[List of Polish monarchs|King of Poland]]. |refimprove section, unreferenced section |- | [[1775]] – [[American Revolutionary War]]: Colonists '''[[Paul Revere]]''', '''[[William Dawes]]''', and '''[[Samuel Prescott]]''' began a "midnight ride" from [[Boston]] to [[Lexington, Massachusetts|Lexington]] to warn residents about the impending arrival of British troops. | Dawes tagged refimprove and it seems unfair to exclude him |- | [[1942]] – [[World War II]]: Sixteen [[B-25 Mitchell]] bombers from the aircraft carrier [[USS Hornet (CV-8)|USS ''Hornet'']]<!-- ''(launch pictured)''--> carried out the '''[[Doolittle Raid]]''', the first [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] attack on the Japanese home islands. | refimprove section |- |[[1961]] – The Soviet '''[[Pluton (complex)|Pluton]]''' [[planetary radar]] performed the world's first successful [[radiolocation]] of the planet Venus. |stub |- |[[1983]] – A suicide bomber '''[[1983 United States embassy bombing|destroyed]]''' the [[Diplomatic missions of the United States|United States Embassy]] in [[Beirut]], Lebanon, killing over 60 people with a [[car bomb]]. |needs more footnotes |- |[[1988]] – [[Iran-Iraq War|Iran–Iraq War]]: [[United States Navy|U.S. naval forces]] '''[[Operation Praying Mantis|attacked]]''' Iranian forces in retaliation for the Iranian [[naval mine|mining]] of the [[Persian Gulf]] and the subsequent damage to the American frigate [[USS Samuel B. Roberts (FFG-58)|USS ''Samuel B. Roberts'']]. |refimprove section |- |[[1992]] – General '''[[Abdul Rashid Dostum]]''' revolted against the [[Democratic Republic of Afghanistan]] and allied with [[Ahmad Shah Massoud]] to capture [[Kabul]]. |Need to verify date – Dostum's article says 18 Apr, but [[Civil war in Afghanistan (1989–1992)]] makes it seem like he defected earlier |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1906]] – A major earthquake and resulting fires '''[[1906 San Francisco earthquake|devastated]]''' [[San Francisco]], killing at least 3,000 people and leaving more than half of the city's population homeless. {{*mp}} [[1958]] – Controversial American poet '''[[Ezra Pound]]''' was released from [[St. Elizabeths Hospital]] in [[Washington. D.C.]], where had been incarcerated for twelve years. </ul> ==Notes== {{*mp}} [[Battles of Lexington and Concord]] appears on April 19; the midnight ride and the battles should not both appear in the same year {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[April 18]]''' <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em"> [[File:Stpetes.JPG|Saint Peter's Basilica by Giovanni Paolo Pannini|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[1506]] – Construction of the current '''[[St. Peter's Basilica]]''' ''(interior pictured)'' in [[Vatican City]], to replace the [[old St. Peter's Basilica|old basilica]] built in the {{nowrap|4th century}}, began. {{*mp}} [[1689]] – Provincial [[militia (United States)|militia]] and citizens gathered in [[Boston]], and '''[[1689 Boston revolt|arrested]]''' officials of the [[Dominion of New England]]. {{*mp}} [[1923]] – The [[New York Yankees]] of [[Major League Baseball]] began playing their games in the newly constructed '''[[Yankee Stadium (1923)|Yankee Stadium]]'''. {{*mp}} [[1938]] – '''[[Superman]]''', created by [[Jerry Siegel]] and [[Joe Shuster]], made his debut in [[Action Comics 1|''Action Comics'' #1]]<!--not bolded, lots of {{tl|cn}} tags-->, the first true [[superhero]] [[comic book]]. {{*mp}} [[1947]] – In one of the [[List of the largest artificial non-nuclear explosions|largest non-nuclear single explosive detonations in history]], the [[Royal Navy]] set off 4,000 [[tonne]]s of surplus [[ammunition]] in an unsuccessful attempt to destroy the island of '''[[Heligoland]]''', Germany. {{*mp}} [[1949]] – '''[[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]]''' officially left the [[Commonwealth of Nations|British Commonwealth]] and became a republic. {{*mp}} [[1996]] – Israeli forces '''[[1996 shelling of Qana|shelled]]''' [[Qana]], Lebanon, during [[Operation Grapes of Wrath]], killing over 100 civilians and injuring over 110 others at a [[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon|UN compound]]. </ul> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=April|Day=18}} <noinclude> </noinclude>
